title: Ratings

# Ratings 

There is a 5-star system used to allow users to share their opinion on a product, documentation page, photo and more. Only whole and half numbers–or in this case stars– can be used.

## Half-star Ratings
Since ratings typically show averages, we need a way to represent fractions of a whole number. That being said, the rating system allows for half stars so we can represent data as accurately as possible. For example, a rating of 3.5 would consist of three full stars and the fourth star would be half filled.

**There can never be ratings smaller than half.** In the scenario where you could have smaller fractions, we encourage rounding to the nearest decimal point of either 0.5 or 1. For instance, 3.3 would be rounded to a 3.5 star rating.

## Usage

There should be five stars displayed at all times, even in cases with a rating less than 5-star. The empty stars would act as a placeholder in this scenario.
